content:
• Friday, November 9, 2012
  • MYRX

    After-hours top gainers, as of 5:15 p.m.: OTC:MYRX +23.5%. NXTM +6.5%. BGCP +5.4%. IO +5.3%....

    After-hours top gainers, as of 5:15 p.m.: OTC:MYRX +23.5%. NXTM +6.5%. BGCP +5.4%. IO +5.3%. MSCC +4.7%.
    After-hours top losers: STSI -10.2%. PEGA -7.5%. ENR -7%. WG -6.7%. EXEL -6%.
     
     
     
     
    | 5:45 PM | 1 Comment
  • NVDA

    Nvidia (NVDA -3.9%) sold off after initially trading higher post-earnings. Soft guidance...

    Nvidia (NVDA -3.9%) sold off after initially trading higher post-earnings. Soft guidance (PC-related) overshadowed decent Tegra sales, which were driven far more by tablets (i.e. the Nexus 7) than smartphones. Nvidia noted on its earnings call it's ramping R&D as it works to develop a Tegra chip containing a baseband modem, something needed to better compete with Qualcomm's Snapdragon line. Separately, CEO Jen-Hsun Huang talked up the potential of the delayed Project Denver to address the budding ARM server CPU market. (FQ3: I, II) (analyst comments)

     
     
     
     
    | 5:31 PM | 4 Comments
  • XIDEQ

    More on Exide (XIDE): FQ2 misses on both counts. Net sales were negatively impacted by both...

    More on Exide (XIDE): FQ2 misses on both counts. Net sales were negatively impacted by both foreign currency translation and lead related pricing. Gross profit declined Y/Y as well, as a combination of the high cost of spent batteries in its Americas unit coupled with a lower LME price of lead weighed on margins. Shares -6% AH.

     
     
     
     
    | 4:49 PM
  • BKNG

    Priceline (PCLN -0.3%) and Expedia (EXPE -0.8%) pared the losses they saw after the Kayak (KYAK...

    Priceline (PCLN -0.3%) and Expedia (EXPE -0.8%) pared the losses they saw after the Kayak (KYAK +28.1%) deal was announced, while TripAdvisor (TRIP +0.6%) fully erased its decline. Nomura's Brian Nowak points out Kayak could take a hit if Expedia (its biggest advertiser) cuts back on spending in response, and that TripAdvisor's 2013 estimates could be at risk if Priceline cuts its ad spending now that it has Kayak as a channel. As far as Priceline goes, Nowak likes the deal's ability to lower Priceline's dependence on Google traffic. (previous)

     
     
     
     
    | 4:20 PM
  • MDVN

    Medivation (NASDAQ:MDVN): Q3 EPS loss of $0.06 misses by $0.02. Revenue of $64.8M beats by $16M....

    Medivation (NASDAQ:MDVN): Q3 EPS loss of $0.06 misses by $0.02. Revenue of $64.8M beats by $16M. (PR) Shares -1% AH.
     
     
     
     
     
    | 4:16 PM
  • PODD

    Insulet (PODD +6.2%) finishes strong despite posting a mixed Q3 report yesterday. Revenue grew...

    Insulet (PODD +6.2%) finishes strong despite posting a mixed Q3 report yesterday. Revenue grew by 22% Y/Y, and investors are focusing on it's pipeline, which includes its OmniPod insulin pump currently awaiting FDA approval. Barrington thinks approval should come within 90 days. The firm expects the stock to outperform its peers once it's granted and reiterates an Outperform rating on the stock.

     
     
     
     
    | 4:06 PM
  • UNG

    Natural gas (UNG -2.6%) futures sink after a report by Weather Derivatives projects heating...

    Natural gas (UNG -2.6%) futures sink after a report by Weather Derivatives projects heating demand 2% below norms from Nov. 15-19 and inventory data released yesterday showed natural gas inventories are more than 6% higher relative to the five-year average.

     
     
     
     
    | 3:59 PM | 3 Comments
  • SWKS

    Skyworks (SWKS +2.7%) is closing with a decent gain after announcing its board has authorized a...

    Skyworks (SWKS +2.7%) is closing with a decent gain after announcing its board has authorized a new $200M stock buyback program, good for repurchasing 5.1% of outstanding shares at current levels. Shares are down over 30% from their early September highs thanks to disappointing earnings forecasts, and now trade at less than 10x FY13E EPS. (PR)

     
     
     
     
    | 3:57 PM
  • ET

    Energy Transfer Partners (ETP +1.7%) is upgraded to Equal Weight from Underweight with a $50...

    Energy Transfer Partners (ETP +1.7%) is upgraded to Equal Weight from Underweight with a $50 price target at Morgan Stanley, which sees the emergence of a path to distribution growth following YTD underperformance (-12%), a solid Q3 (1.01x coverage at ETP), and completion of the SUN merger.

     
     
     
     
    | 3:46 PM | 1 Comment
  • SXL

    Sunoco Logistics' (SXL -4.1%) price target is raised to $51 from $43 at UBS, which notes SXL...

    Sunoco Logistics' (SXL -4.1%) price target is raised to $51 from $43 at UBS, which notes SXL easily beat Q3 with adjusted EBITDA ~14% above consensus. Crude oil pipeline operating was up more than 50% Y/Y on 36% higher revenue/bbl, benefiting not just from higher tariffs Y/Y but also from a mix shift that increased volumes on higher tariff pipes.

     
     
     
     
    | 3:37 PM
  • DAR

    Darling International (DAR +4.5%) gains after posting better-than-expected Q3 revenue. Total...

    Darling International (DAR +4.5%) gains after posting better-than-expected Q3 revenue. Total sales declined slightly Y/Y, due primarily to lower finished product selling prices in its rendering segment as a result of changes in supply and demand in both the domestic and export markets for commodity fats. However, the lower selling prices were offset by increased volumes, which contributed to a solid top line performance.

     
     
     
     
    | 3:10 PM
  • NBL

    Rosetta Resources' (ROSE +1.9%) price target is raised to $68 from $64 by Canaccord, which says...

    Rosetta Resources' (ROSE +1.9%) price target is raised to $68 from $64 by Canaccord, which says the company is "doing an outstanding job prosecuting the development of its highly productive Eagle Ford leasehold." The firm cites stronger growth in oil production and the associated pricing benefit of a higher oil composition in the liquids stream.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:58 PM
  • IONS

    Isis Pharmaceuticals (ISIS) +15% today after an upgrade to Outperform on valuation at Cowen. The...

    Isis Pharmaceuticals (ISIS) +15% today after an upgrade to Outperform on valuation at Cowen. The firm cites optimism surrounding its antisense platform and a strong pipeline that includes its cholesterol treatment Kynamro, which should get FDA approval early next year.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:47 PM
  • FSLR

    First Solar (FSLR +2.9%) and SunPower (SPWR +3.6%) continue to have a good week. Hopes are up...

    First Solar (FSLR +2.9%) and SunPower (SPWR +3.6%) continue to have a good week. Hopes are up that Pres. Obama's re-election will mean the DOE's strong financial support for U.S. solar projects will remain in place. MEMC (WFR +3.8%) is also rallying. (previous)

     
     
     
     
    | 2:42 PM | 2 Comments
  • SD

    SandRidge Energy (SD -5%) is retained as a Buy but with a reduced $8.50 target price at Stifel...

    SandRidge Energy (SD -5%) is retained as a Buy but with a reduced $8.50 target price at Stifel Nicolaus after disappointing 2013 guidance released yesterday along with better than expected Q3 earnings. The guidance is a negative because oil volumes essentially remain flat while gas volumes rise 27% Y/Y, which the firm believes will hinder cash flow.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:34 PM
  • CALL

    Only 3 weeks after posting solid Q3 results and 2012 guidance, magicJack VocalTek (CALL +9.2%)...

    Only 3 weeks after posting solid Q3 results and 2012 guidance, magicJack VocalTek (CALL +9.2%) says it expects 2012 GAAP EPS to be above its "previous estimated range." The provider of VoIP hardware and services said in its Q3 PR it has "a good chance to achieve over $2.00 GAAP EPS" for 2012. (PR)

     
     
     
     
    | 2:26 PM
  • MRO

    Marathon Oil (MRO +2.3%) is upgraded to Overweight with a raised $35 price target (from $30) by...

    Marathon Oil (MRO +2.3%) is upgraded to Overweight with a raised $35 price target (from $30) by J.P. Morgan, which believes improving results in the Eagle Ford and Bakken shale plays underpin a loftier near-term production growth outlook, and a potential sale of oil sands operations could unlock additional value. and an exploration program could spark share price catalysts.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:21 PM | 2 Comments
  • HTZ

    The FTC wants more concessions out of Hertz Global (HTZ +5.3%) before it will allow the...

    The FTC wants more concessions out of Hertz Global (HTZ +5.3%) before it will allow the acquisition of Dollar Thrifty (DTG +4.4%) to move forward, according to Bloomberg. Sources say the talks have turned acrimonious as the regulator presses Hertz to give up more airport locations. Shares of both companies spiked higher off of the report before easing off again.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:12 PM | 2 Comments
  • POZN

    Pozen (POZN +10.3%) moves up on an upgrade to Strong Buy at Ascendiant Capital. The firm says...

    Pozen (POZN +10.3%) moves up on an upgrade to Strong Buy at Ascendiant Capital. The firm says the recent pullback in share price following its Q3 earnings miss yesterday has created a buying opportunity.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:11 PM
  • GEOKQ

    Geokinetics (GOK +63.5%) shares surge after last night's announcement of the immediate...

    Geokinetics (GOK +63.5%) shares surge after last night's announcement of the immediate resignation of Richard Miles as CEO and as a member of the board of directors after five years at the helm. David Crowley, currently President and COO, will serve as the new President and CEO.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:10 PM
  • UBNT

    Ubiquiti Networks (UBNT +16.8%) has taken off after missing FQ1 estimates but guiding for FQ2...

    Ubiquiti Networks (UBNT +16.8%) has taken off after missing FQ1 estimates but guiding for FQ2 revenue of $70M-$78M and EPS of $0.17-$0.20, mostly above a consensus of $69.1M and $0.17. Low expectations are helping, and so is a huge short interest. Ubiquiti claims to have made progress with the counterfeiting problems that crushed shares earlier this year, and brags sales of new products such as its airFiber wireless backhaul solution rose 24% Q/Q. (transcript)

     
     
     
     
    | 1:53 PM
  • BHC

    Morgan Stanley - which assisted Q-Med in its battle for control back in 2008 - weighs in on the...

    Morgan Stanley - which assisted Q-Med in its battle for control back in 2008 - weighs in on the the complaint filed by Q-Med against Medicis (MRX -5.4%) blocking its merger with Valeant Pharmaceuticals (VRX), saying it shouldn't pose a risk to the deal closing. Q-Med claims it has the right to withhold consent to a change of control of MRX that would result in a transfer of exclusive rights to market and sell its dermal filler products, and that Medicis has breached its agreements.

     
     
     
     
    | 1:39 PM
  • FB

    Facebook (FB -0.7%) and Zynga (ZNGA -2.3%) are underperforming in the wake of Groupon's Q3...

    Facebook (FB -0.7%) and Zynga (ZNGA -2.3%) are underperforming in the wake of Groupon's Q3 disaster. Also possibly hurting their cause is a Nielsen report estimating the monthly time spent on Facebook's PC site by the average U.S. user fell 29 minutes from March to September, to 6:40:32, as mobile usage grows. Nielsen's figures back up comScore's. Facebook is down 9% since a lockup expired on Oct. 29. A much bigger lockup expiration arrives on Wednesday.
     
     
     
     
    | 1:30 PM | 2 Comments
  • BHC

    Medicis (MRX -4.8%) slides after disclosing in an SEC filing that it had been sued by...

    Medicis (MRX -4.8%) slides after disclosing in an SEC filing that it had been sued by dermatological product maker Q-Med - whose products are sold by MRX - alleging it has the right to block MRX's pending merger with Valeant Pharmaceuticals (VRX -0.7%). Valeant agreed to buy Medicis for $44 per share in September.

     
     
     
     
    | 1:06 PM
  • T

    Leap Wireless (LEAP +6%) is rallying for the second day in a row thanks to new speculation a...

    Leap Wireless (LEAP +6%) is rallying for the second day in a row thanks to new speculation a spectrum deal or full-blown sale will happen. Sprint's (NYSE:S) cancellation of a conference presentation, together with Leap's Wednesday earnings call remarks regarding its willingness to sell excess spectrum, are the triggers this time around. Nomura suggests investors stay cautious, noting the $2.8B value assigned by Leap to its spectrum is barely above its $2.6B net debt position. Leap filed its Q3 10-Q this morning.

     
     
     
     
    | 1:02 PM
  • DIS

    Disney (DIS -5.3%) continues to trade lower as a host of analysts lower their expectations for...

    Disney (DIS -5.3%) continues to trade lower as a host of analysts lower their expectations for the company primarily due to fears advertising revenue could be under pressure. Comments from execs on yesterday's earnings call (transcript) highlighted the idea the company is transitioning from an investment phase (Lucasfilm, Cars Land, Disneyland) into a growth mode. Reading between the lines of analyst comments, Disney investors may have to play a waiting game for those investments to pay dividends and for the economy to turn around to help drive revenue higher.

     
     
     
     
    | 12:54 PM | 8 Comments
  • FXEN

    FX Energy (NASDAQ:FXEN): Q3 EPS of -$0.16 misses by $0.17. Revenue of $10M (-5% Y/Y). Daily...

    FX Energy (NASDAQ:FXEN): Q3 EPS of -$0.16 misses by $0.17. Revenue of $10M (-5% Y/Y). Daily production was 13.2MMcfe/day, up 10% Y/Y. Shares +1.5% AH. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 12:44 PM
  • EYPT

    pSivida (PSDV +3.5%) gains in spite of a mixed FQ1 report late yesterday. What's driving the...

    pSivida (PSDV +3.5%) gains in spite of a mixed FQ1 report late yesterday. What's driving the move is its announcement that it's received FDA clearance to proceed on two pivotal Phase III clinical trials of its lead development product, an injectable micro-insert for posterior uveitis. The trials, scheduled to begin next year, will form the basis for a future NDA submission. (PR)

     
     
     
     
    | 12:41 PM | 1 Comment
  • PSX

    Phillips 66 (PSX -2.4%) has been "badly affected" by Hurricane Sandy, so Deutsche Bank...

    Phillips 66 (PSX -2.4%) has been "badly affected" by Hurricane Sandy, so Deutsche Bank downgrades shares to Hold from Buy over weather and related shortage impacts on northeast U.S. oil markets that comprise 27% of U.S. oil demand and 6% of global demand. Only HollyFrontier (HFC +1.4%) remains rated at Buy among big refiners covered by the firm.

     
     
     
     
    | 12:38 PM | 3 Comments
  • JCP

    Retail stat of the day (h/t WSJ's Dana Mattioli): In the first nine months of the year, J.C....

    Retail stat of the day (h/t WSJ's Dana Mattioli): In the first nine months of the year, J.C. Penney (JCP -7%) lost $2.7B in sales which just so happens to be roughly equivalent to the annual sales for Saks. The early word on Q4 doesn't look promising either, with one analyst dourly noting on CNBC that comps are down as much as 30%-35% over the last few weeks.

     
     
     
     
    | 12:36 PM
  • RRC

    Range Resources (RRC +2%) growth targets are attainable and warrant a premium, Capital IQ says,...

    Range Resources (RRC +2%) growth targets are attainable and warrant a premium, Capital IQ says, but the firm thinks current valuations are sustainable only by a major hike in gas prices, which it doesn't see. Natural gas prices likely will remain under pressure, pinching RRC’s cash flows and returns at a time of high capital expenditures, the firm says in keeping its Sell rating on shares.

     
     
     
     
    | 12:27 PM
  • SPRD

    Spreadtrum (SPRD -10%) gets downgraded to Neutral by JPMorgan following its Q3 report, which...

    Spreadtrum (SPRD -10%) gets downgraded to Neutral by JPMorgan following its Q3 report, which featured soft gross margin data. The firm thinks monthly shipments of smartphones featuring Spreadtrum's baseband chips will peak in November due to the end of China Mobile's (NYSE:CHL) 2012 3G phone procurement program, and that CHL's 2013 procurement plan might not arrive until after the Chinese New Year. JPMorgan also cautions Spreadtrum's dual-core chips might not begin shipping until April. (transcript)

     
     
     
     
    | 12:21 PM
  • NES

    Heckmann (HEK): Q3 EPS of -$0.06 misses by $0.04. Revenue of $93M (+94.8% Y/Y) misses by $3M....

    Heckmann (HEK): Q3 EPS of -$0.06 misses by $0.04. Revenue of $93M (+94.8% Y/Y) misses by $3M. Shareholders approve issuance of shares in connection with the previously announced merger with Power Fuels. Shares +6.5% AH. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 12:15 PM | 3 Comments
  • AFFY

    Affymax (OTC:AFFY +10.2%) trades up after posting a narrow Q3 earnings beat late yesterday....

    Affymax (OTC:AFFY +10.2%) trades up after posting a narrow Q3 earnings beat late yesterday. Total revenue increased marginally, by 3% Y/Y, but lower expenses gave a boost to bottom line margins. In its earnings call, the company says that operating expenses are projected to be lower for FY12 as well, now expecting to incur between $130M and $135M in costs, versus previous projections of $135M to $145M. The reduction is primarily driven by lower than expected increases in SG&A expenses due to cost savings. (Transcript)

     
     
     
     
    | 12:13 PM
  • DLB

    Audio tech providers Dolby (DLB -6.1%) and (especially) DTS (DTSI -25.3%) are getting hammered...

    Audio tech providers Dolby (DLB -6.1%) and (especially) DTS (DTSI -25.3%) are getting hammered after posting their calendar Q3 reports (I, II). Citing a "softening near-term business environment," DTS is guiding for 2012 revenue of $100M-$105M and 2013 revenue of $140M-$150M, below a consensus of $110.1M and $160.2M. Dolby beat estimates thanks to smartphone/tablet deals and provided in-line FQ1 and FY13 guidance. But it mentioned on its earnings call FQ4 PC sales fell 6% Y/Y, and consumer electronics sales 10%.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:54 AM | 1 Comment
  • ERF

    Enerplus (ERF -12.1%) shares sink after the Canadian oil and gas producer reports a Q3 loss due...

    Enerplus (ERF -12.1%) shares sink after the Canadian oil and gas producer reports a Q3 loss due to certain asset impairments and says it expects growth to slow down next year as it cuts 2013 capital spending by 20%. ERF, which has crude oil assets in the Bakken and Three Forks fields in North Dakota, also cuts its average production forecast for 2012 by 2% to 82K boe/day.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:53 AM | 5 Comments
  • MCPIQ

    Molycorp (MCP -4.4%) resumes trading after a brief halt, as an SEC filing discloses an SEC...

    Molycorp (MCP -4.4%) resumes trading after a brief halt, as an SEC filing discloses an SEC investigation regarding the accuracy of disclosures of certain sales of stock by officers, directors and private equity firms, as well as certain corporate acquisitions during 2011.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:38 AM | 7 Comments
  • WPRT

    More on Westport Innovations (WPRT +10.5%): In its earnings call last night, CEO David Demers...

    More on Westport Innovations (WPRT +10.5%): In its earnings call last night, CEO David Demers noted that order activity remains high and that revenue growth is expected to be around 30% for FY13, which remains consistent with long-term forecasts. Additionally, its heavy-duty business is seeing repeat orders from customers such as UPS who've ordered 21 additional LNG tractors with WPRT's high pressure direct injection, and programs with CAT to jointly develop LNG as a fuel in mining truck and locomotive operations are off to a strong start. (Transcript)

     
     
     
     
    | 11:35 AM
  • WPRT

    It looks to be 'much ado about nothing' for Westport Innovations (WPRT +9%) this morning as the...

    It looks to be 'much ado about nothing' for Westport Innovations (WPRT +9%) this morning as the stock abruptly reverses course to trade markedly higher following its Q3 earnings miss and trading halt yesterday. The stock initially opened down nearly 5% in after it resumed trading during the post-session yesterday, but quickly executed an about-face during the pre-open session and hasn't looked back since.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:16 AM | 8 Comments
  • MBOT

    StemCells (STEM -6.1%) takes a hit after its Q3 came up far short of estimates yesterday. The...

    StemCells (STEM -6.1%) takes a hit after its Q3 came up far short of estimates yesterday. The company reported a $0.54 loss for the period, missing Street estimates for a loss of $0.17. Revenue was also behind the curve, coming in at $264K, versus analysts expectations of $430K. Other expenses for the quarter weighed on bottom-line results, largely due to a non-cash expense from an increase in the estimated fair value of its warrant liability.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:00 AM
  • GRPN

    The bottom is falling out of Groupon (GRPN -28.2%) after a bleak Q3 report (I, II) leaves...

    The bottom is falling out of Groupon (GRPN -28.2%) after a bleak Q3 report (I, II) leaves observers wondering when its daily deals and international billings will finally stabilize. Evercore's Ken Sena, whose bearish stance is vindicated today, notes Groupon's $1.2B cash balance is partly offset by $600M in payables and accrued expenses, something that could hurt cash flow as sales decline. He's raising his 2013 e-commerce sales forecast by $700M, but lowering his daily deals billings forecast by $1.5B. (also) (transcript)
     
     
     
     
    | 10:59 AM | 8 Comments
  • ARRY

    Drug developer Array BioPharma (ARRY -12.3%) slides after pricing an 18M share secondary...

    Drug developer Array BioPharma (ARRY -12.3%) slides after pricing an 18M share secondary offering at $3.65 per share, a 10% discount to yesterday's close. The company had 95.4M shares outstanding as of October, which would make the sale nearly a 19% dilution to its float.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:39 AM
  • DIOD

    Analog chipmakers Diodes (DIOD -7%) and Microsemi (MSCC -5%) are heading south following their...

    Analog chipmakers Diodes (DIOD -7%) and Microsemi (MSCC -5%) are heading south following their Q3 reports (I, II). Though Diodes' Q4 revenue guidance ($160M-$167M vs. $164M consensus) was in-line, its gross margin forecast of 23%-27% is underwhelming, given the midpoint is below Q3's 26.2%. Microsemi is guiding for Q4 revenue of $262M-$268M and EPS of $0.57-$0.60, mostly below a consensus of $268.1M and $0.60. The chip industry remains mired in a slump. (Diodes PR) (Microsemi PR)

     
     
     
     
    | 10:34 AM
  • RNDY

    Roundy's (RNDY -17.1%) slumps after the firm misses estimates on its top and bottom lines for...

    Roundy's (RNDY -17.1%) slumps after the firm misses estimates on its top and bottom lines for Q3. While general weakness in the economy hurt results, the company also acknowledges promotions activity didn't perform as well as expected. New guidance for FY12 includes an outlook for sales growth of 1% to 1.5% and EPS of $1.05 to $1.12.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:20 AM
  • PVR

    PVR Partners (PVR -4.7%) announces a public offering of 6.5M common units representing limited...

    PVR Partners (PVR -4.7%) announces a public offering of 6.5M common units representing limited partner interests at $23.11/unit. PVR intends to use the net proceeds to pay down a portion of its debts. PVR has ~88.2M common units outstanding.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:14 AM | 1 Comment
  • TUMI

    Tumi Holdings (TUMI -2.7%) slips a bit in early trading after pricing its secondary offering of...

    Tumi Holdings (TUMI -2.7%) slips a bit in early trading after pricing its secondary offering of 10.1M shares at $21.10, a 1.4% discount to its Thursday close.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:05 AM
  • CRAY

    Cray (CRAY +10.8%) is rallying after delivering a Q3 beat and providing implied Q4 revenue...

    Cray (CRAY +10.8%) is rallying after delivering a Q3 beat and providing implied Q4 revenue guidance of $218M, above a $211.9M consensus. Q3 gross margin was 48%, up 700 bps Q/Q and 400 bps Y/Y. Cray shares have had a pretty good year. Separately, Cray has announced it's acquiring fellow supercomputer maker Appro for $25M in cash. Appro specializes in cluster systems, an increasingly popular architecture that involves using hundreds or thousands of distributed nodes. (PR)

     
     
     
     
    | 10:05 AM
  • NFLX

    Shares of Netflix (NFLX +2.4%) trade higher after Carl Icahn pitches the case on CNBC that the...

    Shares of Netflix (NFLX +2.4%) trade higher after Carl Icahn pitches the case on CNBC that the company is undervalued. Though a growing number of analysts see Icahn's dream of a big-time NFLX buyer as a bit of a lost cause, it can't be forgotten Icahn is already sitting on some tidy profits with most of his trades fired off during the summer doldrums for the stock.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:03 AM
  • AMFW

    Foster Wheeler (FWLT +3.2%) enjoys an opening lift after cost cuts boosted Q3 profits even as...

    Foster Wheeler (FWLT +3.2%) enjoys an opening lift after cost cuts boosted Q3 profits even as revenues slipped appreciably. FWLT raises its full-year 2012 EBITDA margin guidance to 20%-22% in its global power unit, and maintains full-year margin guidance in global engineering and construction at 11%-13%. FWLT sees FY12 EPS "materially higher than 2011" (consensus +15%).

     
     
     
     
    | 10:00 AM
  • LGF.A

    Shares of Lions Gate (LGF +8.2%) roar to a gain after the media company smashed the estimates of...

    Shares of Lions Gate (LGF +8.2%) roar to a gain after the media company smashed the estimates of analysts with its FQ2 report. A bigger-than-expected boost from video sales of The Hunger Games helped drive revenue higher. FQ3 is also set up nicely for strong numbers with the final movie in the Twilight series scheduled to open on November 16.
     
     
     
     
    | 9:46 AM
  • AMRN

    Amarin (NASDAQ:AMRN) up 4.1% premarket after posting a per-share GAAP loss of $0.18 (a $0.26...

    Amarin (NASDAQ:AMRN) up 4.1% premarket after posting a per-share GAAP loss of $0.18 (a $0.26 loss excluding compensation and derivative-value issues), roughly in line with analyst expectations of a $0.22-$0.25 loss. The late-stage biopharma noted an FDA approval for a use of its Vascepa capsules in treating hypertriglyceridemia, and the development of eight new patents to go alone with 30 other applications pending.

     
     
     
     
    | 9:25 AM
  • JCP

    More on J.C. Penney's (NYSE:JCP) earnings call: 2013 is the year the retailer returns to growth,...

    More on J.C. Penney's (NYSE:JCP) earnings call: 2013 is the year the retailer returns to growth, according to CEO Ron Johnson. His vision includes a JCP (shops) within J.C. Penney (old-school department store) where iPad look-books, automated check-out, and upscale shops bring in consumers to an atmosphere where they can drink coffee and buy upscale products. It's no surprise that RJ mentions the success of Apple's retail stores a few times, but the vast difference in square footage makes the analogy confusing. Execs spent so much time filibustering that the Q&A is relatively uneventful. JCP -8.9% premarket. (webcast)

     
     
     
     
    | 9:19 AM | 15 Comments
  • CAR
